V akciji Manj svečk za manj grobov zbrali več kot 54.000 evrov
04 Nov 2019, 10:14 by STA

V ekološko-humanitarni akciji Manj svečk za manj grobov so do zdaj zbrali 54.226 evrov, zbiranje denarja prek SMS sporočil še poteka. Zbrani denar bodo namenili kritju stroškov zdravljenja, nakupu zdravstvene opreme, kompletov prve pomoči in za reševanje ob poplavah ter z višin, so sporočili iz Fundacije Svečka.



“Nič ni narobe, če namesto 15 kupimo 14 sveč in kakšen evro namenimo za reševanje življenj," meni vodja akcije Manj svečk za manj grobov Primož Jelševar. Foto: Maja Pertič Gombač

LJUBLJANA > "Projekt temelji na spoštovanju tradicije, da se našim pokojnim dostojno poklonimo. Nič ni narobe, če zanje prižgemo svečo, če na grob položimo cvetje in se jih spomnimo na ta način. Nič pa tudi ni narobe, če namesto 15 kupimo 14 sveč in kakšen evro namenimo za reševanje življenj," je v sporočilu zapisal vodja akcije Primož Jelševar.
Gre za trajnostno akcijo, kjer se na grob namesto sveče položi zastavico. Denar, ki bi ga porabili za nakup sveč, pa nameni v dobrodelne namene. "Prav je, da skrbimo za lepo urejene grobove preminulih, vendar je vsak trenutek, ki ga preživimo s svojimi najdražjimi, tisočkrat več vreden kot najlepše urejen grob," je zapisal Jelševar.
Do zdaj zbrani denar so večinoma darovali obiskovalci pokopališč na stojnicah. Do konca tedna bodo zbirali donacije prek SMS sporočil, fundacija pa tudi še prejema donacije organizacij.
V dobrodelni akciji je sodelovalo 140 organizacij in več kot 500 prostovoljcev. Stojnice so letos postavili v Kopru, Litiji, Mariboru, Murski Soboti, Zagorju ob Savi, Trbovljah, Hrastniku, Celju, Dobrepolju, Dolu pri Ljubljani, Domžalah, Grosuplju, Ivančni Gorici, Savi, Šentjurju, Škofji Loki, Logatcu, Šmartnem pri Litiji, Vojniku in Vuzenici.

More than 54,000 euros were raised in the Fewer Candles campaign for fewer graves
04 Nov 2019, 10:14 by STA

So far, the eco-humanitarian campaign Fewer Candles for Less Graves has raised € 54,226, while raising money through SMS is still ongoing. The money raised will be used to cover the cost of medical treatment, the purchase of medical equipment, first aid kits and flood relief and heights, the Candle Foundation said.



"There is nothing wrong with buying 14 candles instead of 15, and what kind of euro is spent on saving lives," says the leader of the campaign Less candles for less graves Primož Jelševar. Photo: Maja Pertič Gombač

LJUBLJANA> "The project is based on respect for the tradition of paying homage to our deceased. There is nothing wrong with lighting a candle for them, laying flowers on the grave and remembering them this way. Nothing is wrong if we buy 14 candles instead of 15 and what kind of euro we spend on saving lives, "said the leader of the campaign, Primož Jelševar.
It is a sustainable campaign where a flag is placed on the grave instead of a candle. The money you would spend to buy candles is donated to charity. "It is right to look after the well-groomed graves of the dead, but every moment we spend with our loved ones is worth a thousand times more than the most beautifully groomed grave," Jelsevar wrote.
The money raised so far has been mostly donated by visitors to cemeteries on stands. By the end of the week, they will be collecting donations via SMS, and the foundation will also receive donations from organizations.
The charity campaign involved 140 organizations and more than 500 volunteers. Booths have been erected this year in Koper, Litija, Maribor, Murska Sobota, Zagorje ob Sava, Trbovlje, Hrastnik, Celje, Dobrepolje, Dol pri Ljubljani, Domžale, Grosuplje, Ivančna Gorica, Sava, Šentjur, Škofja Loka, Logatec, Šmartno pri Litiji Soldier and Vuzenica.
